definitions.definition: An element , such as silicon or germanium , intermediate in properties between that of a metal and a nonmetal ; especially an elemental semiconductor .
The metallic base of a fixed alkali , or alkaline earth ; applied to sodium , potassium , and some other metallic substances whose metallic character was supposed to be not well defined.

main_definition: ( chemistry ) An element , such as silicon or germanium , intermediate in properties between that of a metal and a nonmetal ; especially an elemental semiconductor .
secondary_definitions: ( chemistry , obsolete ) The metallic base of a fixed alkali , or alkaline earth ; applied to sodium , potassium , and some other metallic substances whose metallic character was supposed to be not well defined.
